Juliet's heart is as a sea of boundless devotion, wherein each sigh is a wave, each glance a star upon the midnight waters. Her soul doth cry out to his as twin doves that flutter close and nearer still, yearning to be as one. Alas, 'tis a love unyielding as the mighty oak, yet tender as the whisper of a breeze 'pon a summer's eve.

Desire doth tether her heart to his with bonds invisible, stronger than the chains of adamant. In his presence, her soul sings with joy untold; in his absence, a silence as deep as winter's frost doth descend. Thus, by fate's decree, she finds her heart inexorably entwined with his, e'er willing to brave the sorrows of the world for but a glimpse of his countenance, a whisper of his name.
